wf-contribute-subtitle: Our mission is to teach the world how to make anything themselves. We need your help!
wf-contribute-createtuto-subtitle1: Get started and share your skills.
wf-contribute-getstart-subtitle1: The basics for a successful tutorial.
wf-contribute-help-subtitle1: Everything about Wikifab and how it works.
wf-contribute-takingpictures-subtitle1: Our lesson on how to take great pictures for your tutorial
wf-contribute-joincommunity: Want to join the Wikifab community?
wf-formtutorial-alert: Oups! You do not have permission to create a tutorial because your are not log in. To create a tutorial, $1 or $2
wf-formtutorial-main-placeholder: Enter the name of your tutorial
wf-formtutorial-main-subtitle: Learn how to pick the perfect name for your tutorial.
wf-formtutorial-type-popup-creation: your tutorial concerns an object to create (ie: a radio-controlled drone)
wf-formtutorial-type-popup-technique: your tutorial concerns a technique to learn (ie: to tile a floor)
wf-formtutorial-description-field-placeh: Describe your tutorial in a few sentences.
wf-formtutorial-difficulty-popup-text1: Accessible to everyone. An 8 year old child can follow the tutorial without difficulty
wf-formtutorial-difficulty-popup-text2: Accessible to all. An adult can follow the tutorial without difficulty
wf-formtutorial-difficulty-popup-text3: Only an informed adult can follow the tutorial. Requires no special skills
wf-formtutorial-difficulty-popup-text4: Requires mastery of technical skills. An amateur may, however, follow the tutorial
wf-formtutorial-difficulty-popup-text5: Usually reserved for professionals. Requires the mastery of complex technical skills
wf-formtutorial-tags-popup: Enter 4 to 6 keywords to describe your tutorial (separated by comma)
wf-formtutorial-cost-popup: Approx. cost of the materials supposing you need to buy them all (excluding tools).
wf-formtutorial-duration-popup: Total duration to complete the tutorial (resting, drying times etc. included).
wf-prerequisites-tabs-placeholder: Search and add a prerequisite tutorial
wf-formtutorial-file-tabs-option2: Add link(s) to external file management platform
wf-mainpage-title: Tutorials to make anything, written by everyone
wf-mainpage-subtitle: Wikifab empowers individuals to share their creative skills with the rest of the world.
wf-propertyvalue-complete-Yes: Check this box when the tutorial is complete
wf-propertycomplete-check: Check this box when the tutorial is complete
wf-formtutorial-popuplicense-licence1-de: This license lets others distribute, remix, tweak, and build upon your work, even commercially, as long as they credit you for the original creation. This is the most accommodating of licenses offered. Recommended for maximum dissemination and use of licensed materials.
wf-formtutorial-popuplicense-licence2-de: This license lets others remix, tweak, and build upon your work even for commercial purposes, as long as they credit you and license their new creations under the identical terms. This license is often compared to “copyleft” free and open source software licenses. All new works based on yours will carry the same license, so any derivatives will also allow commercial use. This is the license used by Wikipedia, and is recommended for materials that would benefit from incorporating content from Wikipedia and similarly licensed projects.
wf-formtutorial-popuplicense-question: Why those two licenses? What is my interest in publishing my tutorials under these licenses? Read our vision and share your thoughts on
wf-formtutorial-popuptutoname-title: How to pick the perfect name for your tutorial
wf-formtutorial-popuptutoname-subtitle: For the sake of consistency and search optimization, take the time to think about the name of your tutorial:
wf-formtutorial-popuptutoname-option1: If your tutorial concerns the fabrication of an object:
wf-formtutorial-popuptutoname-option1a: Enter the name of the object directly. Do not precede the name with an article (a, the).
wf-formtutorial-popuptutoname-option1d: Do not start the name of your tutorial with the verbs "Make", "Build", "Create", etc. The verb doesn't provide useful information to the user since they already know that they are looking to "make" or "build" something.
wf-formtutorial-popuptutoname-option1f: Specify the main material used, to clarify what your tutorial is about
wf-formtutorial-popuptutoname-option1g: Prefer: Table made from oak and metal
wf-formtutorial-popuptutoname-option2: If your tutorial concerns a technique:
wf-formtutorial-popuptutoname-option2a: Always start with an infinitive verb that describes the technique.
wf-formtutorial-popuptutoname-option2b: Do not start the name of your tutorial by the verbs "Learn", "How to", etc. The verb doesn't provide useful information to the user, since they already know that they are looking to "Learn" something.
wf-formtutorial-popuptutoname-option2d: Rather than: How to sand down a table
wf-formtutorial-popuptutoname-last: If a tutorial with the name you have entered already exists, you will be sent to the form for editing that tutorial.
